attributes.name: accountSubType
attributes.description: Grouping for lower-level categories on the financial statements, e.g. Current Asset, Current Liabilities, Cost of Sales, etc.

attributes.name: accountType
attributes.description: Grouping for high-level category on the financial statements. Values should be assets, liabilities, equity, revenue, expenses, etc.

attributes.name: businessUnitCode
attributes.description: Used to identify the business unit, region, branch, etc. at the level that financial statements are being audited and for which the trial balance is generated. For example, you may use a code aligned with the concept of a reportable segment as defined in FASB Accounting Standards Codification (ASC) 280, Segment Reporting.

attributes.name: chartOfAccountType
attributes.description: Type of COA which can be either operational(standard), country or group(specific).

attributes.name: consolidationGroupChartOfAccounts
attributes.description: Whether the GL to be assigned to group chart of accounts.

attributes.name: controllingIntegration
attributes.description: How postings can be made to account code, e.g. manual or automatic entries.

attributes.name: fsCaption
attributes.description: Financial statement caption. Grouping for the caption the GL account rolls up to on the financial statements, e.g. cash and cash equivalents, accounts payable, cost of sales, etc. Sometimes may prefer to be at the trial balance level.

attributes.name: glAccountDescription
attributes.description: Label or description associated with glAccountNumber.

attributes.name: glAccountName
attributes.description: Name for the GL account.

attributes.name: glAccountNumber
attributes.description: Identifier for the GL account. glAccountNumber in this file must match the glAccountNumber used in the glDetails and trialBalance.

attributes.name: parentGlAccountNumber
attributes.description: A reference to the glAccountNumber that is the parent in an account hierarchy. Provided to allow more than the predefined levels of hierarchy in the chart of accounts table.

attributes.name: segment01
attributes.description: Reserved segment field that can be used for profit centre, division, fund, program, branch, project, etc.

attributes.name: segment02
attributes.description: Reserved segment field that can be used for profit centre, division, fund, program, branch, project, etc.

attributes.name: segment03
attributes.description: Reserved segment field that can be used for profit centre, division, fund, program, branch, project, etc.

attributes.name: segment04
attributes.description: Reserved segment field that can be used for profit centre, division, fund, program, branch, project, etc.

attributes.name: segment05
attributes.description: Reserved segment field that can be used for profit centre, division, fund, program, branch, project, etc.

attributes.name: userDefined1
attributes.description: Having a function or role that is defined and gets varied from user to user.

attributes.name: userDefined2
attributes.description: Having a function or role that is defined and gets varied from user to user.

attributes.name: adjustmentAmount
attributes.description: Adjustment amount for the goods received due to quality or quantity issues.

attributes.name: adjustmentDescription
attributes.description: If an adjustment to the receipt, a description of the reason for the adjustment.

attributes.name: adjustmentIndicator
attributes.description: "0" if the transaction is the original shipment transaction, "1" if the transaction is a shipment adjustment.

attributes.name: approvedBy
attributes.description: userId (from userListing) for person who approved the entry.

attributes.name: approvedByDateTime
attributes.description: The date and time the entry was approved.

attributes.name: businessUnitCode
attributes.description: Used to identify the business unit, region, branch, etc. at the level that financial statements are being audited and for which the trial balance is generated. For example, you may use a code aligned with the concept of a reportable segment as defined in FASB Accounting Standards Codification (ASC) 280, Segment Reporting.

attributes.name: enteredBy
attributes.description: userId (from userListing) for person who created the record.

attributes.name: enteredDateTime
attributes.description: The date the transaction was entered into the system. This is sometimes referred to as the creation date. This should be a system-generated date (rather than user-entered date), when possible. This date does not necessarily correspond with the date of the transaction itself.

attributes.name: goodsReceiptUniqueId
attributes.description: The system-generated unique ID when the goods are received.

attributes.name: goodsReceivedAmount
attributes.description: Total value of the goods received in the functional currency.

attributes.name: goodsReceivedCurrency
attributes.description: Three-letter currency code according to ISO 4217 standard for the functional currency of the entity, e.g. EUR for Euros or USD for American Dollars.

attributes.name: goodsReceivedExchangeRate
attributes.description: The exchange rate used. Currency Amount x Exchange Rate = Amount.

attributes.name: goodsReceivedLocalAmount
attributes.description: The goods received amount recorded in the local (foreign) currency.

attributes.name: goodsReceivedLocalCurrency
attributes.description: Three-letter currency code according to ISO 4217 standard for the local (foreign) currency, e.g. EUR for the Euros or USD for American Dollars.

attributes.name: lastModifiedBy
attributes.description: userId (from userListing) for the last person modifying this entry.

attributes.name: lastModifiedDateTime
attributes.description: The date and time the entry was last modified before posting.

attributes.name: lineAdjustmentAmount
attributes.description: The adjustment amount for the corresponding line item.

attributes.name: lineAdjustmentDescription
attributes.description: The adjustment description for the corresponding line item.

attributes.name: lineAmount
attributes.description: Transaction monetary amount recorded in the functional currency. No multicurrency translation should need to be performed on this amount because all transactions should be recorded in a single currency. Must be absolute.

attributes.name: lineAmountLocal
attributes.description: Amount of the transaction in the local (foreign) currency.

attributes.name: lineAmountLocalCurrency
attributes.description: Three-letter currency code according to ISO 4217 standard for the local (foreign) currency, e.g. for the Euros or USD for American Dollars.

attributes.name: lineExchangeRate
attributes.description: The exchange rate used. Currency Amount x Exchange Rate = Amount.

attributes.name: linePurchaseOrderAmount
attributes.description: The amount for this line item as recorded in the corresponding Purchase Order.

attributes.name: linePurchaseOrderAmountLocal
attributes.description: Order amount in the local (foreign) currency.

attributes.name: linePurchaseOrderAmountLocalCurrency
attributes.description: Three-letter currency code according to ISO 4217 standard for the local (foreign) currency, e.g. EUR for the Euros or USD for American Dollars.

attributes.name: linePurchaseOrderExchangeRate
attributes.description: The Exchange rate for this line item as recorded in the corresponding Purchase Order.

attributes.name: linePurchaseOrderLineId
attributes.description: Identifier for purchase order line number. Must match lineLineNumber used in purchaseOrderData. If no purchase order, leave blank.

attributes.name: linePurchaseOrderQuantity
attributes.description: Purchase order line quantity. If no purchase order, leave blank.

attributes.name: linePurchaseOrderUnitOfMeasure
attributes.description: Purchase order line base unit of measure. If no purchase order, leave blank.

attributes.name: linePurchaseOrderUnitPrice
attributes.description: Purchase order line price per unit. If no purchase order, leave blank.

attributes.name: lineReceiptDocumentLineId
attributes.description: Reference line number on receipt document.

attributes.name: lineReceiptId
attributes.description: Unique identifier for each shipment received. This ID may need to be created by concatenating fields (e.g. document number, document type, and year) to uniquely identify each shipment.

attributes.name: lineReceiptProductBarcode
attributes.description: UPC or other general identifier.

attributes.name: lineReceiptProductDescription
attributes.description: Product description (plain language) to indicate the name or other identifying characteristics of the product.

attributes.name: lineReceiptProductGroup01
attributes.description: Product descriptor #1, e.g. tyres or accessories.

attributes.name: lineReceiptProductGroup02
attributes.description: Product descriptor #2, e.g. brand.

attributes.name: lineReceiptProductId
attributes.description: Identifier that is unique for each product.

attributes.name: lineReceiptQuantity
attributes.description: Item quantity received.

attributes.name: lineReceiptStandardUnitPrices
attributes.description: Standard price per unit of the goods received.

attributes.name: lineReceiptUnitOfMeasure
attributes.description: Base unit of measure.

attributes.name: lineReceiptUnitPrice
attributes.description: Price per unit for item received.

attributes.name: movementType
attributes.description: Specifies the type of goods movement. This will default to the correct code according to selections made in the header, e.g. goods receipt for purchase order onto UoL premises, reversal of the goods receipt for purchase order, Return the delivery to the sender, especially useful if you need to accurately track and document the specific nature of each goods transaction in  inventory management system .

attributes.name: postingStatus
attributes.description: Status of the transaction's posting to the GL, e.g. "Posted" or "Not Posted".

attributes.name: purchaseOrderAmount
attributes.description: The Amount for this receipt as recorded in the corresponding Purchase Order.

attributes.name: purchaseOrderAmountLocal
attributes.description: Order amount in the local (foreign) currency.

attributes.name: purchaseOrderAmountLocalCurrency
attributes.description: Three-letter currency code according to ISO 4217 standard for the local (foreign) currency, e.g. EUR for the Euros or USD for American Dollars.

attributes.name: purchaseOrderDate
attributes.description: The date of the purchase order relating to the goods received.

attributes.name: purchaseOrderExchangeRate
attributes.description: Exchange rate listed on the purchase order relating to the goods received.

attributes.name: purchaseOrderId
attributes.description: Unique identifier for each purchase order. Must match purchaseOrderUniqueID in the purchaseOrderData file. If no purchase order, leave blank.

attributes.name: receiptDate
attributes.description: The date of receipt (date received).

attributes.name: receiptDocumentId
attributes.description: Reference number on receipt shipping document (company reference or logistics company identifier).

attributes.name: receiptFiscalYear
attributes.description: Fiscal year in which the receiptDate occurs.

attributes.name: receiptId
attributes.description: Unique identifier for goods or services received. This ID may need to be created by concatenating fields (e.g. customer and payment number) to uniquely identify each transaction.

attributes.name: receiptPeriod
attributes.description: Fiscal period in which the receiptDate occurs, e.g. W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-M12 for monthly periods, and Q1-Q4 for quarterly periods.

attributes.name: segment01
attributes.description: Reserved segment field that can be used for profit centre, division, fund, program, branch, project, etc.

attributes.name: segment05
attributes.description: Reserved segment field that can be used for profit centre, division, fund, program, branch, project, etc.

attributes.name: supplierId
attributes.description: Identifier of the supplier to whom payment is due. Must match the supplierId in the supplierMasterData.

attributes.name: userDefined1
attributes.description: Having a function or role that is defined and gets varied from user to user.

attributes.name: userDefined2
attributes.description: Having a function or role that is defined and gets varied from user to user.

attributes.name: accountId
attributes.description: accountId associated with supplier company/supplier books of accounts used to identify the entity. The entity's customer number in the supplier's records.

attributes.name: businessUnitCode
attributes.description: Used to identify the business unit, region, branch, etc. at the level that financial statements are being audited and for which the trial balance is generated. For example, you may use a code aligned with the concept of a reportable segment as defined in FASB Accounting Standards Codification (ASC) 280, Segment Reporting.

attributes.name: companyType
attributes.description: Type of company of the vendor/supplier, e.g. B2B, B2C, manufacturing, limited company or similar.

attributes.name: creditNoteAmount
attributes.description: Credit note Amount reference (where applicable) to original invoice.

attributes.name: creditNoteReason
attributes.description: Credit note reason or rationale.

attributes.name: creditNoteReference
attributes.description: Credit note reference (where applicable) to original invoice.

attributes.name: description
attributes.description: Description of the Invoice.

attributes.name: discountAmountAvailable
attributes.description: Discount amount available on the invoice.

attributes.name: discountBase
attributes.description: The base on which the discount is calculated. This can be an amount or a quantity, e.g. litres.

attributes.name: discountTaken
attributes.description: Discount amount taken during payment of invoice.

attributes.name: documentType
attributes.description: Type of document which forms the basis of the record, e.g. supply invoice, credit note, etc.

attributes.name: excessPayment
attributes.description: Any excess payment beyond the total amount due will be displayed.

attributes.name: fiscalPeriod
attributes.description: Fiscal period in which the invoiceDate occurs, e.g. W1-W53 for weekly periods, M1-M12 for monthly periods, and Q1-Q4 for quarterly periods.

attributes.name: fiscalYear
attributes.description: Fiscal year in which invoiceDate occurs.

attributes.name: glAccountNumber

attributes.name: invoiceAmount
attributes.description: Transaction monetary amount recorded in the functional currency. No multicurrency translation should need to be performed on this amount because all transactions should be recorded in a single currency. Must be absolute.

attributes.name: invoiceAmountCurrency
attributes.description: Three-letter currency code according to ISO 4217 standard for the functional currency of the entity, e.g. EUR for Euros or USD for American Dollars.

attributes.name: invoiceAmountLocal
attributes.description: Invoice amount in the local (foreign) currency.

attributes.name: invoiceAmountLocalCurrency
attributes.description: Three-letter currency code according to ISO 4217 standard for the local (foreign) currency, e.g. EUR for the Euros or USD for American Dollars.

attributes.name: invoiceAmountReporting
attributes.description: Transaction monetary amount recorded in the reporting currency.

attributes.name: invoiceAmountReportingCurrency
attributes.description: Three-letter currency code according to ISO 4217 for the currency in which a reporting entity prepares its financial statements, e.g. EUR for the Euros or USD for American Dollars.

attributes.name: invoiceDate
attributes.description: The date of the invoice, regardless of the date the invoice is entered. This is the date from which the due date is calculated based on the invoice terms.

attributes.name: invoiceDocumentReference
attributes.description: The reference number (invoice number) on the purchase invoice, the reference number provided by the supplier.

attributes.name: invoiceDueDate
attributes.description: The date payment is due from the Supplier. Aging of a payable is usually calculated based on this date.

attributes.name: invoiceId
attributes.description: Unique identifier for each invoice. This ID may need to be created by concatenating fields (e.g. document number, document type, and year) to uniquely identify each transaction. The same ID must be used for all tables with invoice data.

attributes.name: invoiceNumber
attributes.description: Identification number for an externally generated invoice.

attributes.name: invoiceType
attributes.description: Type of invoice, e.g. debit invoice, credit invoice, cash, ticket, etc.

attributes.name: invoicePrepaymentAmount
attributes.description: Prepayment amount on the invoice.

attributes.name: paymentAmountExchangeRate
attributes.description: The exchange rate used. Currency Amount x Exchange Rate = Amount.

attributes.name: paymentAmountLocal
attributes.description: Transaction amount in the local (foreign) currency.

attributes.name: paymentAmountLocalCurrency
attributes.description: Three-letter currency code according to ISO 4217 standard for the local (foreign) currency, e.g. EUR for the Euros or USD for American Dollars.

attributes.name: paymentAmountReporting
attributes.description: Transaction monetary amount recorded in the reporting currency.

attributes.name: paymentAmountReportingCurrency
attributes.description: Three-letter currency code according to ISO 4217 for the currency in which a reporting entity prepares its financial statements, e.g. EUR for the Euros or USD for American Dollars.

attributes.name: paymentDate
attributes.description: The date on the which the payment is made to the supplier.

attributes.name: paymentDiscountDays
attributes.description: The number of days from the invoice date the vendor allows to take advantage of discounted terms. Terms are represented as digits with no decimal places, e.g. nnn.

attributes.name: paymentDiscountPercentage
attributes.description: The discount percentage the supplier may provide if an invoice is paid before a certain number of days.

attributes.name: paymentDueDays
attributes.description: The number of days allowed to meet the obligation before an invoice becomes overdue.

attributes.name: paymentId
attributes.description: Unique identifier for each payment made. This ID may need to be created by concatenating fields (e.g. customer and payment number) to uniquely identify each transaction.

attributes.name: paymentMethod
attributes.description: The code value or indicator of the method by which the transaction debit or credit amount was extinguished or apportioned to the debt by the supplier, e.g. check, wire transfer, cash, etc. Must match the paymentMethod in apPaymentData.

attributes.name: paymentRefNo
attributes.description: External reference number for each payment made, e.g. payment reference at bank or with the supplier.

attributes.name: postingDate
attributes.description: The date on which the invoice is posted in the system/ERP.

attributes.name: purchaseOrderDate
attributes.description: The date on which purchase order is created.

attributes.name: purchaseOrderId
attributes.description: Unique identifier for each purchase order. Must match orderNo in purchaseOrderData. If no purchase order, leave blank.

attributes.name: registrationNumber
attributes.description: Unique number to identify the company in the accounting records, issued by a government authority or created by the company for internal purposes to identify different entities within their corporate group.

attributes.name: supplierCreditLimit
attributes.description: The credit limit for the total outstanding balance approved for the supplier.

attributes.name: supplierId
attributes.description: Identifier of the supplier to whom payment is due. Must match the supplierId in the supplierMasterData.

attributes.name: supplierName
attributes.description: The name of the vendor/supplier.
